title: Lucille Ball & Bob Hope 1962 movie lettering
content:
Hi, Looking for ID or closest match to the following two examples. Thanks for any assistance. Alyce

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [HOPE\_BALL-TYPE.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907153212/http:/typophile.com/files/HOPE_BALL-TYPE.gif) | 23.16 KB |

 [‹ (x) Extra bold serif on German book cover - Times Modern {Tim A}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907153212/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31845 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Chad Garrington, kitchen manager" scripts - Balloon, Present Script {David H} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907153212/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31852 "Go to next forum topic")
author: alyce

comments.content: Not a match, but you could try [Billy Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907153212/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=SPAR-BIBO) and [Fresh Paint](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907153212/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=TYPA-FRPA#).
while it isn’t exact, a quick “feels-like” choice might be House industries’ COOP or HARDCORE...
i’m interested in hearing if someone has the dead-on for this; i love the “C.”

Hi all, thanks for the input so far.

Chuck, I tried to ID selected characters on identifont.com but the orientation of the two diffent ends of the C wasn’t an option (there were three choices: both vertical, both horizontal or both at an angle).

I like the C very much too.
